EnableTracker.Name: Initiative Tracker
EnableTracker.Hint: Enables the custom initiative tracker. This feature manages Raises during Action Sequences and Dramatic Sequences.

EnableWounds.Name: Dramatic Wounds Warning
EnableWounds.Hint: Enables the Dramatic Wounds warning. This feature displays a notice in the Approach Roll dialog for heroes, villains, or monsters based on the Dramatic Wounds suffered by actors in the scene. Note: the warning is calculated using the Dramatic Wounds of all actors of type "Player" present in the world.

EnableVillainSkillRank.Name: Villain Skill Rank Helper
EnableVillainSkillRank.Hint: Displays the calculated Skill Rank under the Villainy Rank field on Villain sheets. This tip is useful to quickly reference the value required for Advantages, Sorcery, and Duelist Styles.

SkillRank.Label: Skill Rank: {value}
SkillRank.Description: The Skill Rank is equal to half the Villain’s Strength, rounded up.

QOL.Sorte.Title: Lashes
QOL.Sorte.Rules.Text:
When a Witch uses a Weave, she must spend 1 Hero Point and suffer 1 Lash (some Weaves may cause additional Lashes, but 1 is always the minimum).

A Witch may remove a Lash in two ways:
1. Paying in blood: she suffers a number of Wounds equal to her current Lashes.
2. Paying in misfortune: she gives the GM 1 Danger Point for each Lash she currently has.

After a Witch rolls dice for a Risk, the GM may spend 1 Danger Point to prevent her from using any die result lower than her current number of Lashes.
By spending an additional Danger Point, the GM may apply this effect to a different Hero instead of the Witch: Fate will be repaid one way or another. For example, a Witch with 4 Lashes cannot use results of 1, 2, or 3 to create Raises.
